item.title: Texas Fiber Optic Network Expansion
item.description:
Texas is experiencing significant growth in fiber network availability for businesses due to company partnerships and mergers. Transtelco, a major provider with a fiber network spanning from Houston to Los Angeles and extending into Northern Mexico, has plans to expand its network in both Mexico and Texas. Another significant provider, PAETEC, possesses substantial fiber assets serving major Texas cities like Dallas, Austin, and Houston. PAETEC and Transtelco have entered a joint venture where PAETEC is expanding Transtelco’s fiber connection between El Paso and Temple...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/texas-fiber-optic-network-expansion/

item.title: Is Managed WiFi Right for You?
item.description:
By: John Shepler Broadband internet access is widely available and has become a standard expectation. Consumers rely on it to stay connected while on the move, and businesses use it to provide connectivity to customers and allow employees to work flexibly. Considering 3G and 4G cellular? Cellular broadband on smartphones is excellent for wide area coverage, but it has limitations. Data usage limits can lead to unexpectedly high costs. Additionally, many computers, tablets, and other devices lack built-in cellular connectivity, even if users are willing to pay extra for it...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/is-managed-wifi-right-for-you/
